Semiconductors: The tiny chips powering the global economy
description: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (2/5). As the fourth most traded product globally, electronic components have become essential to most industries. The sector, which is expected to reach nearly $1 trillion by 2026, has now become as powerful and strategic as the oil industry.

Algeria demands 'apologies' and 'reparations' from France for its colonial past
description: Algerian MPs passed a law on Wednesday, December 24, to 'criminalize French colonization,' amid ongoing diplomatic tensions between Algiers and Paris.

headline: Zelensky unveils latest peace plan draft backed by US, setting conditions for demilitarized zone in the Donbas
description: The Ukrainian president opens the door to creating a demilitarized zone supervised by 'international forces' in the part of the Donbas controlled by Kyiv, making the withdrawal of Ukrainian troops conditional on the withdrawal of Russian forces.

headline: Ukraine loses Siversk, a bastion guarding the last quarter of the Donetsk region
description: The Russian invading army has completed its occupation of the city of 10,000 inhabitants, which had held out for three and a half years. The eastern flank of the last conurbation in the Donbas that is still under Ukrainian control now seems exposed.

headline: In New York, the invasion of drunken Santas
description: 'My Christmas under Trump' (3/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. In her latest dispatch, she dives into the Santa Claus convention, where every December 13, locals dress up in honor of the mythical bearded figure – a perfect pretext for a marathon bar crawl.

description: We rounded up our favorite flicks to return to every December, from Christmas classics like 'Elf' and 'The Muppet Christmas Carol' to more unexpected picks such as 'E.T.' and 'Cool Runnings.'

headline: 2025 was the year AI-generated videos flooded social media
description: The endless streams of millions of videos generated by artificial intelligence on Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, X, Facebook and beyond have become inescapable. And users want more.

headline: From Barbie to Labubu, adults find comfort in collectible figurines
description: The craze for Funko Pop! and other Blind Box collectibles has continued to grow, driven by a generation of 'kidults,' adults who embrace their inner child, turning their homes into miniature pop culture museums. Caught between a search for identity, a significant budget and environmental contradictions, this new hobby has become a mainstream phenomenon.
